id.description: The ID/UUID of the member.

orgId.description: The ID/UUID of the organization to which the member belongs.

email.description: The email address of the member.

metadata.description: The metadata of the member. This store some additional information about the member.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the member was created.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the member was last updated.

deletedAt.description: The date and time when the member was deleted.

requestId.description: Request ID, used for tracing the request. This is very helpful for internal teams to debug issues.

details.description: Additional arguments that caused the error

requestId.description: Request ID, used for tracing the request. This is very helpful for internal teams to debug issues.
Request ID, used for tracing the request. This is very helpful for internal teams to debug issues.

type.description: The name of the operation that caused the error

requestId.description: Request ID, used for tracing the request. This is very helpful for internal teams to debug issues.

suggestions.description: Suggestions for the user to fix the error

requestId.description: Request ID, used for tracing the request. This is very helpful for internal teams to debug issues.

type.description: The name of the operation that caused the error

requestId.description: Request ID, used for tracing the request. This is very helpful for internal teams to debug issues.

type.description: The name of the operation that caused the error

requestId.description: Request ID, used for tracing the request. This is very helpful for internal teams to debug issues.

details.description: Additional arguments that caused the error

requestId.description: Request ID, used for tracing the request. This is very helpful for internal teams to debug issues.

details.description: Additional arguments that caused the error

verifyHost.description: The frontend host of the user

VerifyMagicLinkDataDTO.description: Data containing client and token information if verification is successful

message.description: Message indicating the result of the verification

framework.description: The framework used by the client

apiKey.description: The API key associated with the client

email.description: The email associated with the client

orgId.description: The organization ID associated with the client

framework.description: The framework used by the client

mac_address.description: The MAC address of the client device

message.description: Message indicating the result of the tracking operation

id.description: Unique ID of the client

eventWebhookURL.description: Event webhook URL for the client

triggersEnabled.description: Whether triggers are enabled for the client

isNewWebhook.description: Whether to use new webhook format

has_completed_onboarding.description: Indicates if the member has completed onboarding

id.description: Unique identifier for the member

orgId.description: Organization ID associated with the member

updatedAt.description: Last update timestamp of the member

deletedAt.description: Deletion timestamp of the member, if applicable

id.description: Unique identifier for the API key

clientId.description: Client ID associated with the API key

memberId.description: Member ID associated with the API key

createdAt.description: Creation timestamp of the API key

updatedAt.description: Last update timestamp of the API key

deletedAt.description: Deletion timestamp of the API key, if applicable

key.description: Key value of the API key

member.description: Member associated with the API key

lastUsed.description: Last used timestamp of the API key

projectId.description: The ID of the project to delete

id.description: The ID or UUID of the project

verifyHost.description: The host to verify the member

role.description: The role that will be assignied to the invited user

id.description: The uuid identifier for the member

createdAt.description: The creation date of the member record

role.description: The role that is assigned to the member

updatedAt.description: The last update date of the member record

memberId.description: The uuid identifier for the member

role.description: The role that is assigned to the member

name.description: The name of the API key to be generated

id.description: The ID of the API key

name.description: The name of the API key

createdAt.description: The creation date of the API key

updatedAt.description: The last update date of the API key

isHidden.description: Whether the API key is hidden

lastUsed.description: The last used date of the API key

member.description: The member of the API key

id.description: The ID of the API key to be deleted

deleted.description: The status of the delete operation

key.description: Unique key/slug used to identify the app in URLs and API calls.

name.description: Human-readable display name of the app

description.example: Enterprise CRM solution for managing customer relationships and sales pipelines

logo.description: URL to the app's logo image, used for UI display

docs.description: The documentation URL of the app, if available. Usually it's a link to the doc to setup and configure the app.

configuration_docs_text.description: The configuration documentation text of the app. This is deprecated and not used anywhere.

status.description: The status of the app. This is deprecated and not used anymore.

documentation_doc_text.description: The documentation text of the app. This is deprecated and not used anywhere.

testConnectors.description: The test connectors available for the app. If this is not empty, it means composio allows you to setup this app without configuring and setting up your own auth app.

no_auth.description: Indicates if the app is of `no_auth` type. If this is true, you can directly use the app without creating any integration.

auth_schemes.description: The authentication schemes supported by the app. This contains all the fields and details needed to setup and configure auth for this app.

name.description: The unique identifier name of the tool to be added. Must be URL-friendly and unique across the system

openApiSpecYaml.description: The complete OpenAPI/Swagger specification in YAML format defining the tool's API endpoints, parameters, and responses
openApiSpecYaml.example:
openapi: 3.0.0
info:
  title: My API
  version: 1.0.0

integrationYaml.description: YAML configuration specifying integration details including authentication, endpoints mapping, and other tool-specific settings
integrationYaml.example:
auth:
  type: oauth2
endpoints:
  base_url: https://api.example.com

id.description: Unique identifier (UUID) for the OpenAPI specification

name.description: Human-readable name of the OpenAPI specification. Used for display and reference purposes

clientId.description: Unique identifier of the client who owns this OpenAPI specification

lastSyncAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when the specification was last synchronized with the source

status.description: Current processing status of the OpenAPI specification in the pipeline. Indicates success, failure, or processing state

state.description: Current state of the app FSM

message.description: Message indicating successful deletion of tools

open_api_spec_yaml.description: The OpenAPI specification in YAML format

integration_yaml.description: The integration details in YAML format

category.description:
Filter apps by category. Used to retrieve apps belonging to a specific group or type.
            To get a list of available categories, see the [Get App Categories](#operation/getAppCategories) endpoint.

additionalFields.description: Comma-separated list of additional fields to include in the response. Allows customizing the response payload for app details. Supported fields: auth_schemes

includeLocal.description: Filter to include locally developed/testing apps in the response. Must be 'true' or 'false'

key.description: Unique key/slug for the app, used in URLs and API references

auth_schemes.description: The authentication schemes of the app

enabled.description: Indicates if the app is enabled

no_auth.description: Indicates if the app has no authentication

createdAt.description: The creation date of the app

updatedAt.description: The last update date of the app

name.description: The unique identifier/key for this input field that will be used when submitting values. Must be URL-safe.

type.description: The data type of this field. Common types include 'string', 'number', 'boolean', etc.

description.description: Detailed explanation of what this field is used for and any special requirements or formatting needed.

display_name.description: Human-readable label that will be shown to users when they need to input this field.

default.description: Default value for this field if none is provided. Set to null if no default exists.

required.description: Indicates if this field must be provided for the connector to function properly.

expected_from_customer.description: Indicates if this field needs to be provided by the end user rather than being automatically populated.

is_secret.description: If true, this field contains sensitive information and should be handled securely (e.g. passwords, API keys).

id.description: Unique identifier for the connector. You can use this ID when calling endpoints like `POST /api/v1/connectedAccounts` to create connections.

authScheme.description: The authentication method used by this connector. Refer to the API documentation for supported authentication schemes.

name.description: The display name of this specific connector configuration.

createdAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when this connector was created.

updatedAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when this connector was last modified.

enabled.description: Whether this connector is currently active and can be used to create new connections. Can be toggled using the connector management endpoints.

deleted.description: Soft deletion status of the connector. If true, the connector has been marked for deletion but may still exist in the system.

appId.description: The ID of the application this connector belongs to. You can find available apps using the `GET /api/v1/apps` endpoint.

defaultConnectorId.description: If this is a custom connector, this field may reference the original template connector it was based on.

authConfig.description: Configuration object containing authentication settings. Sensitive values will be redacted. The structure varies based on the authScheme.

expectedInputFields.description: List of fields that need to be collected from users to set up a connection using this connector. These fields should be included when calling `POST /api/v1/connectedAccounts`.

logo.description: URL to the application's logo image that can be displayed in the UI.

appName.description: The name of the application this connector integrates with.

useComposioAuth.description: When true, indicates that this connector uses Composio's built-in authentication handling rather than custom authentication logic.

scopes.description: List of OAuth scopes to request during the OAuth flow. These scopes determine what permissions the connector will have on the target service.

user_scopes.description: List of user-specific OAuth scopes to request during the OAuth flow. Some APIs differentiate between app-level and user-level scopes.

name.description: A unique name for your connector. This will be used to identify the connector in the system.

authScheme.description: The authentication scheme used by the connector. Refer to the `/api/v1/apps` endpoint to see supported authentication schemes for each app.

authConfig.description: Configuration options for authentication. Required when using OAuth-based authentication schemes.

useComposioAuth.description: When set to true, the connector will use Composio's built-in authentication system. Learn more in the Authentication section of the API documentation.

appId.description: UUID of the Composio app to use for authentication. You can get this from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/apps` endpoint. Either specify this or appName.

appName.description: Name of the Composio app to use for authentication. You can get this from the `name` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/apps` endpoint. Either specify this or appId.

forceNewIntegration.description: When set to true, creates a new integration even if one already exists for the given app. This is useful when you need multiple integrations with the same service.

authConfig.description: Authentication configuration for the connector. This object contains the necessary credentials and settings required to authenticate with the external service. You can get the required configuration fields from the `GET /api/v1/connectors/{connectorId}/config` endpoint.

enabled.description: Flag to indicate if the connector is enabled. When set to false, the connector will not process any requests. You can toggle this value to temporarily disable the connector without deleting it. Default value can be found in the `GET /api/v1/connectors/{connectorId}` endpoint response.

status.description: Status of the patch operation. Returns 'success' when the connector is successfully updated. For detailed information about possible status values, refer to the API documentation at `PATCH /api/v1/connectors/{connectorId}`.

appName.description: Name of the application associated with this connector. You can find this in the response of the `GET /api/v1/apps` endpoint.

_count.description: Aggregate count of connections associated with this connector. This helps track how many connected accounts are using this connector configuration.

connections.description: List of connections associated with this connector, including their IDs and request log counts. Each connection represents a unique connected account using this connector configuration.

id.description: Unique identifier (UUID) of the connector. You can use this ID when calling endpoints like `GET /api/v1/connectors/{id}` or `PUT /api/v1/connectors/{id}`.

name.description: Display name of the connector. This name is used to identify the connector in the UI and API responses.

authScheme.description: Authentication scheme used by this connector. Determines how authentication is handled for connected accounts. See the Authentication Schemes section in the API documentation for more details.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when this connector was created. Returned in ISO 8601 format.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when this connector was last updated. Returned in ISO 8601 format.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the connector is currently enabled. Disabled connectors cannot be used to create new connections.

deleted.description: Soft deletion flag for the connector. When true, the connector is marked as deleted but remains in the database. You can filter deleted connectors using the `includeDeleted` query parameter in list endpoints.

appId.description: Unique identifier (UUID) of the app this connector belongs to. You can use this ID to fetch app details via the `GET /api/v1/apps/{id}` endpoint.

defaultConnectorId.description: ID of the default connector configuration. When present, this indicates that this connector inherits settings from the specified default connector. You can manage default connectors via the `/api/v1/defaultConnectors` endpoints.

ConnectorListItemDTO.description: List of connectors with their details and associated connections

items.description: Array of connector items matching the query parameters. Each item contains detailed information about a connector and its associated connections.

totalPages.description: Total number of pages available based on the current page size. Use this for implementing pagination controls.

page.description: Current page number (1-based). You can request different pages using the `page` query parameter in the `GET /api/v1/connectors` endpoint.

connectedAccountId.description: UUID of the connected account you want to get auth credentials for. You can get this from the `id` field in the response of the [/api/v1/connectedAccounts](/api-reference/connections/list-connections) endpoint.

integrationId.description: The ID of the integration this connection belongs to. You can get this from the [/api/v1/integrations](/api-reference/integrations/list-integrations) endpoint.

connectionParams.description: Additional parameters specific to this connection. Structure varies by integration type.

isDisabled.description: Flag indicating if this connection is currently disabled.

invocationCount.description: Number of times this connection has been invoked/used.

status.description: The status of the toggle operation ('success' or 'failed').

Authorization.description: Authorization header value used for API requests.

x-request-id.description: Request ID header for tracing API calls.

ConnectionParamsHeaders.description: Headers to be included in API requests.

scopes.description: Space-separated OAuth scopes for the connection.

client_id.description: OAuth client ID for the application.

callback_url.description: OAuth callback URL for the connection.

client_secret.description: OAuth client secret for the application.

code_verifier.description: PKCE code verifier used in OAuth flow.

refresh_token.description: OAuth refresh token for obtaining new access tokens.

queryParams.description: Query parameters to be included in API requests.

base_url.description: Base URL for API requests to the connected service.

get_current_user_endpoint.description: Endpoint URL to fetch current user information from the connected service.

MetaApp.description: Additional information related to the app.

Meta.description: Additional information related to the connected account.

integrationId.description: The ID of the integration to which the connected account belongs. You can get this from the [/api/v1/integrations](/api-reference/integrations/list-integrations) endpoint.

appUniqueId.description: The unique ID of the app to which the connected account belongs. To get the full app info, you can use the [/api/v1/apps](/api-reference/apps/get-single-app) endpoint.

isDisabled.description: Flag to indicate if the connected account is disabled. If this is true, the connected account will not be able to be used for any actions.

id.description: The unique identifier for this connected account.

clientUniqueUserId.description: The entityId to which the connected account belongs. **Deprecated: ** Please use the `entityId` field instead.

appName.description: The name of the app this account is connected to. You can get the list of available apps from the [/api/v1/apps](/api-reference/apps/list-apps) endpoint.

entityId.description: The entity ID associated with the connection. Learn more about entities [here](https://docs.composio.dev/patterns/Auth/connected_account#entities).

status.description: The current status of the connection (e.g. 'active', 'inactive', 'pending').

enabled.description: Flag to indicate if the connected account is enabled. This will be true if the connected account is active and can be used to perform actions.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the connected account was created.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the connected account was last updated.

items.description: Array of connection objects matching the query parameters.

totalPages.description: Total number of pages available based on the pageSize.

page.description: Current page number in the pagination.

base_url.description: The base URL of the connection. This is the starting part (or base part) of the URL that you need to send requests to. This is especially useful when you are working with apps that have dynamic urls (based on connection params) like Shopify.

body.description: The body params to send with the request. Some apps require this to be sent in the body of the request for authentication.

name.description: The name of the parameter. For example, 'x-api-key', 'Content-Type', etc.

in.description: The location of the parameter. Can be 'query' or 'header'.

value.description: The value of the parameter. For example, '1234567890', 'application/json', etc.

Parameter.description: The parameters to send with the request. This contains all the headers, query params, etc. that are required to make requests to the third-party service directly.

field1.description: First field of the data object.

field2.description: Second field of the data object.

page.description: The page number for pagination. Defaults to 1 if not specified.

pageSize.description: The number of items per page for pagination. Defaults to 99999999 if not specified - this is a temporary fix to support backward compatibility issues. Please specify this value to avoid fetching all connections at once.

appNames.description: Comma-separated list of app names to filter connections by. You can get the app names from the [/api/v1/apps](/api-reference/apps/list-apps) endpoint.

labels.description: Comma-separated list of labels to filter connections by.

showActiveOnly.description: Flag to show only active connections. Defaults to false if not specified.

status.description: The status of the connection to filter by.

integrationId.description: The ID/UUID of the integration to filter connections by. You can get the integration ID from the [/api/v1/integrations](/api-reference/integrations/list-integrations) endpoint.

connectionId.description: UUID of the connected account you want to get auth credentials for. You can get this from the `id` field in the response of the [/api/v1/connectedAccounts](/api-reference/connections/list-connections) endpoint.

user_uuid.description: Comma-separated list of entity IDs to filter connections by. This field is deprecated - please use entityId instead.

entityId.description: Comma-separated list of entity ids of the user to filter connections by. Learn more about entities [here](https://docs.composio.dev/patterns/Auth/connected_account#entities).

showDisabled.description: Flag to include disabled connections in the results. Defaults to false if not specified.

connectedAccountId.description: The ID of the connected account to get details for. You can get this from the `id` field in the response of the [/api/v1/connectedAccounts](/api-reference/connections/list-connections) endpoint.

x-project-id.description: The ID of the project to get the connections for. Defaults to the first project in the list of projects. You can get the project ID from the [/api/v1/projects](/api-reference/client/get-projects) endpoint.

data.description: The data required to initiate a connection. Structure varies by integration type.

integrationId.description: The ID of the integration for which the connection is being initiated. You can get this from the [/api/v1/integrations](/api-reference/integrations/list-integrations) endpoint.

redirectUri.description: The URL to redirect to after the connection is successfully initiated.

userUuid.description: Deprecated: UUID of the user initiating the connection.

entityId.description: The entity ID to associate with the connection. Learn more about entities [here](https://docs.composio.dev/patterns/Auth/connected_account#entities).

labels.description: Array of labels to associate with the connection for organization and filtering.
Array of new labels to assign to the connection.

connectionStatus.description: The current status of the initiated connection.

connectedAccountId.description: The ID of the newly created connected account.

redirectUrl.description: URL to redirect to for completing the connection process, if required.

requestId.description: Request ID, used for tracing the request. This is very helpful for internal teams to debug issues.

type.description: The name of the operation that caused the error

data.description: The response data returned by the action execution.

error.description: The error message, if the action failed to execute. If the action is successful, this will be null.

successfull.description: Whether the action execution was successfully executed or not. If this is false, error field will be populated with the error message.

successful.description: Whether the action execution was successfully executed or not. If this is false, error field will be populated with the error message.

base_url.description: The base URL (root address) what you should use while making http requests to the connected account. For example, for gmail, it would be 'https://gmail.googleapis.com'

body.description: The body to be sent to the endpoint for authentication. This can either be a JSON field or a string. Note: This is very rarely neeed and is only required by very few apps.

CustomAuthDTO.description: Custom authentication credentials to use while executing an action.

type.description: The type of request body to use for the action. Defaults to 'none'.

data.description: The data to be sent to the endpoint. This will override the body set in the connected account.

actionId.description: The id of the action to get details for. This can be found in the id field in [/api/v2/actions](/api-reference/actions/list-actions) endpoint.

connectedAccountId.description: The connected account uuid to use for the action.

endpoint.description: The endpoint to call for the action. If the given url is relative, it will be resolved relative to the base_url set in the connected account info.

method.description: The HTTP method to use for the action.

body.description: The body to be sent to the endpoint. This can either be a JSON field or a string.

SessionInfoDTO.description: Used internally by our SDK's to keep track of the source of execution, ignore it.

arguments.description: The arguments for the action needed to execute the given task.

error.description: The error message if the arguments were not generated successfully.

connectedAccountId.description: Connected account uuid for the account you want to run the action on. You can get this from the id field in [/api/v1/connectedAccounts](/api-reference/connections/list-connections) endpoint.

appName.description: The name/id of the app that the action belongs to. To get the app name, you can use the [/api/v1/apps](/api-reference/apps/list-apps) endpoint.

entityId.description: (Optional) EntityId that represents your users connections - if the required connection is availabe for the user, it'll be auto-picked. If you are passing this, there's no need to pass `connectedAccountId`. To know more about entityId, [click here](https://backend.composio.dev/patterns/Auth/connected_account#entities)

input.description: Action inputs or aguments to execute the action. This is a dict/map with key-value structure, depdning on the action schema you can find in [/api/v2/actions/{actionName}](/api-reference/actions/get-single-action) endpoint.

text.description: The use-case description for the action, this will give context to LLM to generate the correct inputs for the action.

customDescription.description: The custom description for the action, use this to provide customised context about the action to the LLM to suit your use-case.

systemPrompt.description: The system prompt to be used by LLM, use this to control and guide the behaviour of the LLM.

text.description: The use-case description for the action, this will give context to LLM to generate the correct inputs for the action.

customDescription.description: The custom description for the action, use this to provide customised context about the action to the LLM to suit your use-case.

systemPrompt.description: The system prompt to be used by LLM, use this to control and guide the behaviour of the LLM.

requestId.description: Request ID, used for tracing the request. This is very helpful for internal teams to debug issues.

type.description: The name of the operation that caused the error

description.description: The description of the action, tailored to improve the LLM accuracy and reasoning. Use this a tool/function description.

displayName.description: The display name of the action, used to identify the action in the UI.

logo.description: The logo of the app that the action belongs to.

name.description: The name of the action, used to identify the action in the UI.

tags.description: The tags of the action, used to categorize the action in the UI.

deprecated.description: Whether the action is deprecated, if true, avoid using this action.

apps.description: Comma separated list of app names to filter the action tags by.

parameters.description: Required parameters for the action to execute. For example, if the action is GMAIL_SEND_EMAIL, the required parameters for actions execution would be the email address, subject, and body.

response.description: Expected response structure after action execution. You can use this to quickly check what happened with the action execution.

appKey.description: The name of the app that the action belongs to. This is same as appId.

appName.description: The name of the app that the action belongs to,

appId.description: The id of the app that the action belongs to. This is same as the appKey. Please use appKey instead.

description.description: The description of the action, tailored to improve the LLM accuracy and reasoning. Use this a tool/function description.

displayName.description: The display name of the action, used to identify the action in the UI.

logo.description: The logo of the app that the action belongs to.

name.description: The name of the action, used to identify the action in the UI.

tags.description: The tags of the action, used to categorize the action in the UI.

deprecated.description: Whether the action is deprecated, if true, avoid using this action.

items.description: List of all the action tags available in composio

page.description: Current page number in the paginated response

useCase.description: Use case is deprecated. Please provide this in the body instead to avoid max-uri-length error.

response_data.description: Indicates if the action was executed successfully

appNames.description: Comma-separated list of app names to filter connections by. You can get the app names from the `name` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/apps` endpoint.

connectedAccountIds.description: Comma-separated list of connected account IDs to filter triggers by. Returns all the possible triggers you can setup for these connected accounts. You can get the connected account IDs from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/connections` endpoint.

triggerIds.description: Comma-separated list of trigger names to filter triggers by. You can get the trigger names from the `name` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/triggers` endpoint.

integrationIds.description: Comma-separated list of integration IDs to filter triggers by. You can get the integration IDs from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/integrations` endpoint.

showEnabledOnly.description: When set to true, returns only enabled triggers. This field is deprecated and will be removed in future versions.

connectedAccountIds.description: Comma-separated list of connected account IDs to filter triggers by. You can get these IDs from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/connections` endpoint.

integrationIds.description: Comma-separated list of integration IDs to filter triggers by. You can get these IDs from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/integrations` endpoint.

triggerIds.description: Comma-separated list of trigger IDs to filter triggers by. You can get these IDs from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/triggers` endpoint.

triggerNames.description: Comma-separated list of trigger names to filter triggers by. You can get these names from the `name` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/triggers` endpoint.

page.description: Page number for pagination. Starts from 1.

limit.description: Number of items to return per page.

showDisabled.description: When set to true, includes disabled triggers in the response.

connectionId.description: Filter logs by connection ID. You can get this from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/connections` endpoint.

integrationId.description: Filter logs by integration ID. You can get this from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/integrations` endpoint.

page.description: Page number for pagination. Starts from 1.

limit.description: Number of items to return per page.

name.description: Unique identifier of the trigger. This is used to reference the trigger in other API calls.

display_name.description: Human-readable name of the trigger shown in the UI.

description.description: Detailed description of what the trigger does.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the trigger is currently enabled.

config.description: Configuration parameters required for the trigger. Structure varies based on trigger type.

payload.description: Sample payload that will be sent when the trigger fires.

logo.description: URL of the trigger's icon or logo.

count.description: Number of times this trigger has been activated.

appKey.description: Unique key identifying the app this trigger belongs to.

appId.description: Unique identifier of the app this trigger belongs to. You can get this from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/apps` endpoint.

appName.description: Name of the app this trigger belongs to.

instructions.description: Step-by-step instructions on how to set up and use this trigger.

type.description: Classification or category of the trigger.

name.description: Unique identifier of the trigger. Used to reference the trigger in other API calls.

displayName.description: Human-readable name of the trigger shown in the UI.

description.description: Detailed description of what the trigger does and when it fires.

type.description: Classification or category of the trigger.

appId.description: Unique identifier of the app this trigger belongs to. You can get this from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/apps` endpoint.

appName.description: Name of the app this trigger belongs to.

instructions.description: Step-by-step instructions on how to set up and use this trigger.

payload.description: Sample payload that will be sent when the trigger fires.

config.description: Configuration parameters required for the trigger. Structure varies based on trigger type.

repo.description: Name of the repository to monitor.

owner.description: Owner (user or organization) of the repository.

id.description: Unique identifier of the trigger instance.

connectionId.description: ID of the connected account this trigger is associated with. You can get this from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/connections` endpoint.

triggerName.description: Name of the trigger. You can get this from the `name` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/triggers` endpoint.

triggerData.description: Additional data associated with the trigger instance.

createdAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the trigger instance was created.

updatedAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the trigger instance was last updated.

disabledAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the trigger instance was disabled, if applicable.

clientId.description: Unique identifier of the client that initiated the trigger.

connectionId.description: ID of the connection associated with this log entry. You can get this from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/connections` endpoint.

errorTrigger.description: Error message if the trigger failed.

triggerClientError.description: Client-side error message if any occurred.

triggerClientPayload.description: Payload sent by the client when the trigger was activated.

triggerProviderPayload.description: Payload received from the provider's API.

triggerName.description: Name of the trigger that generated this log entry.

id.description: Unique identifier for this log entry.

appKey.description: Key identifying the app associated with this log entry.

createdAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when this log entry was created.

appName.description: Name of the app handling the trigger. You can get this from the `name` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/apps` endpoint.

clientId.description: Unique identifier of the client initiating the trigger.

body.description: Payload data to be processed by the trigger.

connectedAccountId.description: ID of the connected account to enable the trigger for. You can get this from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/connections` endpoint.

triggerName.description: Name of the trigger to enable. You can get this from the `name` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/triggers` endpoint.

triggerId.description: Unique identifier of the trigger to retrieve. You can get this from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/triggers` endpoint.

triggerConfig.description: Configuration parameters for the trigger. Structure varies based on trigger type.

verifyHost.description: Host URL for webhook verification, if required.

triggerId.description: Unique identifier of the trigger instance to update. You can get this from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/triggers/active` endpoint.

enabled.description: New enabled/disabled state for the trigger.

triggerInstanceId.description: Unique identifier of the trigger instance to modify. You can get this from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/triggers/active` endpoint.

callbackURL.description: URL where webhook notifications should be sent when the trigger fires.

message.description: Additional information about the operation result.

triggerId.description: Unique identifier of the affected trigger.

isNew.description: Indicates whether a new trigger was created (true) or an existing one was modified (false).

callbackURL.description: The currently configured webhook callback URL.

id.description: Unique identifier of the trigger.

connectionId.description: ID of the connection this trigger is associated with. You can get this from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/connections` endpoint.

triggerName.description: Name of the trigger. You can get this from the `name` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/triggers` endpoint.

triggerData.description: Additional data associated with the trigger.

triggerConfig.description: Configuration parameters for the trigger. Structure varies based on trigger type.

createdAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the trigger was created.

updatedAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the trigger was last updated.

disabledAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the trigger was disabled, if applicable.

disabledReason.description: Reason why the trigger was disabled, if applicable.

id.description: Unique identifier of the project.

isNewWebhook.description: Indicates whether this is a newly created webhook.

channel_name.description: The channel name for the CLI session

key.description: The key for the CLI session

apiKey.description: The API key associated with the client

email.description: The email associated with the metadata request

metadata.description: Additional metadata as a key-value pair

enabled.description: Flag to enable or disable triggers

message.description: Message indicating the result of the toggle operation

id.description: The unique id of the log

createdAt.description: The date and time when the log was created

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the log was updated

clientId.description: The client uuid of the log

connectionId.description: The connection id of the log

triggerProviderPayload.description: The trigger provider payload of the log

triggerClientError.description: The trigger client error of the log

triggerName.description: The trigger name of the log

triggerClientResponse.description: The trigger client response of the log

TriggerMetadata.description: Metadata associated with the trigger log

id.description: The unique id of the log

request.description: The request sent to the provider

errorRequest.description: The error request sent to the provider

createdAt.description: The date and time when the log was created

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the log was updated

clientId.description: The client uuid of the log

connectionId.description: The connection id of the log

actionName.description: The action name of the log

id.description: The unique identifier of the trigger log

connectionId.description: The connection identifier associated with the trigger log

clientId.description: The client identifier associated with the trigger log

status.description: The status of the trigger log

appName.description: The name of the application associated with the trigger log

createdAt.description: The creation date and time of the trigger log

id.description: The unique identifier of the action log

connectionId.description: The connection identifier associated with the action log

clientId.description: The client identifier associated with the action log

status.description: The status of the action log

appName.description: The name of the application associated with the action log

createdAt.description: The creation date and time of the action log

nextCursor.description: The cursor to get the next page of logs

time.description: Time interval for which data needs to be fetched

apps.description: Comma separated list of composio apps to filter by. You can get the list of apps by using [/api/v1/apps](/api-reference/apps/list-apps) endpoint.

actions.description: Comma separated list of composio actions to filter by. You can get the list of actionIds from this API or you can get it by running `composio actions` command in your terminal.

tags.description: Comma separated list of composio action tags to filter by. You can get the list of action tags by using [/api/v2/actions/list/tags](/api-reference/actions/list-action-tags) endpoint.

useCase.description: Smart use-case based search for actions needed to be performed as per the use-case. This uses AI to understand the use-case and then finally returns the list of actions. **Note:** If you are using this field, you can not use actions or tags fields.

page.description: Page number to be returned, default is 1

limit.description: Limit the number of actions to be returned, default is 30

filterImportantActions.description: Filter and return only important actions. This is equivalent to setting tags='important' in the query params mentioned above.

lastTimePeriod.description: Time period to get the data for

totalCount.description: Total count of actions for the app

ActionAnalyticsDTO.description: Comprehensive trigger analytics data, presenting a breakdown by day, status, and provider for all triggers

id.description: Unique identifier for the integration

connectionCount.description: Count of connections for the integration

triggerCount.description: Count of triggers for the integration

requestLogsCount.description: Count of request logs for the integration

IntegrationsWithCountsDTO.description: Detailed integration analytics data, including a breakdown of connection count, trigger count, and request logs count for each integration

connectionCount.description: Count of connections for the app

triggerCount.description: Count of triggers for the app

requestLogsCount.description: Count of request logs for the app

AppNameCountDTO.description: Comprehensive app-level analytics data, providing a breakdown of connection count, trigger count, and request logs count for each app

lastTimePeriod.description: Time period to get the data for

count.description: Count of connections for the client unique user id

AnalyticsEntityDataDTO.description: Entity-related analytics data, providing a breakdown by connections, actions, and triggers for each entity. This is include all entity info.

count.description: Count of connections for the entity

query.description: Query to get the data for

startTime.description: Start time of the event in ISO 8601 format

endTime.description: End time of the event in ISO 8601 format

status.description: The status of the SDK error

api_key.name: x-api-key
api_key.description: API key for authentication, you can easily get it from the [dashboard](https://app.composio.dev/settings) after login or if you are using CLI, you can get it from the `composio whoami` command

post.description: Add a new project to the client's organization

delete.description: Delete a project from the client's organization

get.description: List of available app categories, can be used to filter apps.

schema.description:
Filter apps by category. Used to retrieve apps belonging to a specific group or type.
            To get a list of available categories, see the [Get App Categories](#operation/getAppCategories) endpoint.
Comma-separated list of additional fields to include in the response. Allows customizing the response payload for app details. Supported fields: auth_schemes
Filter to include locally developed/testing apps in the response. Must be 'true' or 'false'

get.description: List all apps based on the given filters, if any. This will return all available apps if no filters are provided.

schema.description: The page number for pagination. Defaults to 1 if not specified.

The number of items per page for pagination. Defaults to 99999999 if not specified - this is a temporary fix to support backward compatibility issues. Please specify this value to avoid fetching all connections at once.
Comma-separated list of app names to filter connections by. You can get the app names from the [/api/v1/apps](/api-reference/apps/list-apps) endpoint.
Comma-separated list of labels to filter connections by.
Flag to show only active connections. Defaults to false if not specified.
The status of the connection to filter by.
The ID/UUID of the integration to filter connections by. You can get the integration ID from the [/api/v1/integrations](/api-reference/integrations/list-integrations) endpoint.

UUID of the connected account you want to get auth credentials for. You can get this from the `id` field in the response of the [/api/v1/connectedAccounts](/api-reference/connections/list-connections) endpoint.
Comma-separated list of entity IDs to filter connections by. This field is deprecated - please use entityId instead.
Comma-separated list of entity ids of the user to filter connections by. Learn more about entities [here](https://docs.composio.dev/patterns/Auth/connected_account#entities).
Flag to include disabled connections in the results. Defaults to false if not specified.

200.description: Get all connections for the current user

400.description: Validation error with the provided filters. Please check your input.

get.description: Get all connections in the current project.

200.description: Initiates a connection for the given integration and mark the connection status as initiated if the auth scheme is OAuth1 or OAuth2

400.description: Failed to initiate connection due to various reasons such as invalid payload or app schema not found. Please check the details field for more information.

404.description: Integration pass is not found, check if the integrationId passed is correct and enabled.

200.description: Retrieve details of a specific connected account by its ID

404.description: Connection with the specified ID not found

get.description: Get authentication crdentials for the connected account, i.e all the headers, query parameters, etc. that are required to make requests to the third-party service directly.

schema.description: Comma-separated list of app names to filter connections by. You can get the app names from the `name` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/apps` endpoint.

Comma-separated list of connected account IDs to filter triggers by. Returns all the possible triggers you can setup for these connected accounts. You can get the connected account IDs from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/connections` endpoint.
Comma-separated list of trigger names to filter triggers by. You can get the trigger names from the `name` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/triggers` endpoint.
Comma-separated list of integration IDs to filter triggers by. You can get the integration IDs from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/integrations` endpoint.
When set to true, returns only enabled triggers. This field is deprecated and will be removed in future versions.

post.description: Enables a trigger for a connected account and specific trigger name.

schema.description: Comma-separated list of connected account IDs to filter triggers by. You can get these IDs from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/connections` endpoint.
Comma-separated list of integration IDs to filter triggers by. You can get these IDs from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/integrations` endpoint.
Comma-separated list of trigger IDs to filter triggers by. You can get these IDs from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/triggers` endpoint.
Comma-separated list of trigger names to filter triggers by. You can get these names from the `name` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/triggers` endpoint.
Page number for pagination. Starts from 1.
Number of items to return per page.
When set to true, includes disabled triggers in the response.

get.description: Lists active triggers based on query parameters.

patch.description: Switches the status of a trigger instance.

post.description: Sets a universal callback URL for the client.

get.description: Retrieves the universal callback URL set for the client.

schema.description: Filter logs by connection ID. You can get this from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/connections` endpoint.
Filter logs by integration ID. You can get this from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/integrations` endpoint.
Page number for pagination. Starts from 1.
Number of items to return per page.

Comma separated list of composio actions to filter by. You can get the list of actionIds from this API or you can get it by running `composio actions` command in your terminal.
Comma separated list of composio action tags to filter by. You can get the list of action tags by using [/api/v2/actions/list/tags](/api-reference/actions/list-action-tags) endpoint.

Smart use-case based search for actions needed to be performed as per the use-case. This uses AI to understand the use-case and then finally returns the list of actions. **Note:** If you are using this field, you can not use actions or tags fields.
